dialogues.text: I think it's a...

dialogues.text: It's a wheel, that's all.   It's a tire.

dialogues.text: For God's sake, be careful of your shoes.

dialogues.text: He leaves the door open. Above him, the tremendous CLANGING noise of CARS POUNDING along the expressway. But he can't see them. He can only hear them and feel their vibration. He stands there a moment, taking in the strangeness of the place and of his own situation -- the tire, Maria, his wife, his life. A little chill of lone- liness hits him. dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sherman!

dialogues.text: He turns, tire in his hands and sees...

dialogues.text: No thanks. Hi. No, I don't think so. No. Thank you very much.

dialogues.text: Excuse me.   I have to go.

dialogues.text: Oh, yes, sir, I did. I recorded this conversation on this tape. My tape. This is my tape of my conversation. I recorded it. Yes, sir. Yes, sir, three bags full.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out of my face. All of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sherman, Killian and Kramer return to their seats. The court starts screaming again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want some fucking order in here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: )J(   BONFIRE OF THE VANITIES - Rev. 4/25/90

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He bangs the gavel until the noise subsides.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming) So you insist on testing the will of this court!!!! Now you shut up and sit down!! All of you! Very well. In the case of the People versus Sherman McCoy, the Grand Jury has returned an indictment. Based on the evidence contained in this recording... (holds up the tape) ... and pursuant to my authority to supervise the Grand Jury's proceedings...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (scream) Whitewash!! Whitewash!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: )J(   BONFIRE OF THE VANITIES - Rev. 4/25/90

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I am ordering the indictment dismissed in the interests of justice, without prejudice and with leave to re-present by the District Attorney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The courtroom explodes.    Screams fill the air -- "Racis Peckerwood! Pussyface!     Motherfucker!" etc. The sound is deafening. Sherman and Killian shake hands. The demonstrators are chanting, "Justice! Justice! Justice!"

dialogues.speaker: DOORS OF COURTROOM
dialogues.text: burst open.    Reporters and photographers rush into the room.

dialogues.speaker: WHITE
dialogues.text: rises on the bench like an eagle.    He pounds the gavel repeatedly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Justice. We want justice!!!   We want justice!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Justice! You want justice?!   I'll give you justice!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally, the courtroom goes quiet. White looks around. Everyone is quiet. And then a single VOICE rings out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You racist pig!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You dare call me a racist! Well, I say to you, you -- a mob who dares to come into these walls -- I say to you, what does it matter ... the color of a man's skin? If witnesses perjure themselves... and a prosecutor, a sworn officer of the court, enlists the perjurers ... and a district attorney throws a man to the mob and lawyers carve up that man for his money... and men of the cloth, men of God take the prime cuts! Now you tell me -- IS THAT JUSTICE?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: )S(   BONFIRE OF THE VANITIES - Rev. 5/18/90

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't hear you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More silence.    He comes down off the bench, facing the mob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell you what justice is not. Justice is not the will of the few and it's not the will of the many. Justice is not politics. Justice is the law. And the law is man's feeble attempt to set down the principles of decency. Decency! And decency is not a deal. Or an angle, or a contract, or a hustle or a campaign or a trick or a bid for sympathy. Decency is not the beast that bays for money, power, dominion, position, votes and blood! Decency is what your mother taught you! Decency is in your bones! Do I make myself clear! Now go home. Go home now. Be decent people. Be decent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moment of quiet as White comes down and faces Sherman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're free to go, Mr. McCoy.

dialogues.speaker: COURTROOM
dialogues.text: as another blood-curdling roar goes up from the crazed mob. They close in on the Judge and Sherman.

dialogues.speaker: REVEREND BACON
dialogues.text: with a bullhorn, egging on the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bald-headed Uncle Tom pussy!!                     * (to the crowd)                                 * Are you going to take this Park                       * Avenue justice!? Are you?                             *

dialogues.speaker: CROWD
dialogues.text: closing in on Sherman and the Judge. The Judge grabs Sherman and pulls him through the door. )S(    BONFIRE OF THE VANITIES - Rev. 5/18/90

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: come out of the courtroom, pursued by the spectators. They are pressed against a huge statue of "blind justice" at the end of the corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: rushing at Sherman and the Judge from different sides.

dialogues.speaker: STATUE
dialogues.text: teeters.

dialogues.speaker: KRAMER
dialogues.text: in the mob, pressing toward Sherman and the Judge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not finished with you, McCoy. You'll be back in this courtroom. This decision will be appealed until I see you behind bars! You hear me, Judge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get your fucking face out of my way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This fucking face is going to see you shining shoes in Grand Central Station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More pushing until...

dialogues.speaker: STATUE
dialogues.text: falls. People scream and scatter. The statue shatters as it hits the floor. The bronze sword slides across the floor and comes to rest at Sherman's feet.

dialogues.speaker: SCENE
dialogues.text: The Judge is hit on the head by some debris. He stumbles, blinded by the plaster dust. Sherman grabs the sword.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taunting the Judge) This fucking face is going to see you selling pencils, you black son of a bitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: )S(    BONFIRE OF THE VANITIES - Rev. 5/18/90

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Sherman whacks Kramer with the sword. Kramer falls away. Sherman helps the Judge down the corridor.

dialogues.speaker: BACON AND FOX
dialogues.text: coming out of the courtroom, intercepting Sherman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sherman McCoy! You shall not escape. You shall live in fear on this island, in the mighty sea of people, for the people -- and justice -- are waiting for you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sherman whacks Bacon. The choir women start to wail. Fox approaches Sherman offering his card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've been woefully misrepresented here, Mr. McCoy. I think you should give me a call...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sherman whacks Fox with the sword and continues down the corridor with the Judge.

dialogues.speaker: WEISS
dialogues.text: giving an interview for a TV news team.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and I promise you and the people of this city that Henry Lamb will not be forgotten. Henry Lamb will live, like the Alamo, as a symbol of slaughtered innocence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weiss sees Sherman and attacks him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And this man's name will live in infamy. Like Adolf Hitler! Like Son of Sam! Like Idi Amin! John Wilkes Booth! Ted Bundy! Jesse Helms!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sherman smacks Weiss with the sword and moves toward the stairs with the Judge.

dialogues.speaker: FALLOW
dialogues.text: approaches Sherman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: )S(    BONFIRE OF THE VANITIES - Rev. 5/18/90

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sherman! Sherman! Congratulations. This is going to make one hell of a story!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You again!   Who are you?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, sorry. I'm Peter Fallow.      I'm Peter Fallow. Ha. Ha. Ha.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sherman looks at him for a moment. Then he lets out a screaming war cry and smacks Fallow with the sword.

dialogues.speaker: FALLOW
dialogues.text: falls to the ground.      He looks up.    He smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.   I needed that.

dialogues.speaker: SHERMAN AND JUDGE
dialogues.text: move down the stairs and out the iron gates of the court- house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: pulls the gates shut and slides the sword through the door handles, locking the crowd inside the courthouse. They pound on the gates as the courtroom guards try to hold them back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm alright.   Damn hooligans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks up to the iron gates. The faces of the demon- strators are pressed against it. The Judge shakes a tired fist at them. Then he turns to Sherman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you. You, too. You go home now. And be decent. You hear me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hear you, Your Honor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Judge shakes his fist at Sherman, too. Then he opens the fist and offers his hand to Sherman. Sherman takes it. They shake. )S(    BONFIRE OF THE VANITIES - Rev. 5/18/90

dialogues.speaker: PETER FALLOW
dialogues.text: through the iron gates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was the last I saw of Sherman McCoy...

dialogues.speaker: SCENE
dialogues.text: Sherman turns and walks away down the corridors of justice. The Judge watches him go. Sherman disappears into a great whiteness as we hear:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And so we come to the end of our story. Sherman, you see, who started with so much, lost everything. But he gained his soul. Whereas I, you see, who started with so little, gained everything...

dialogues.text: coming out of the wall of flashbulbs we saw at the beginning. A vast crowd of black ties and evening gowns surge toward him, cheering, applauding. A voice rings out on a microphone...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... the winner of the Pulitzer Prize, the National Book Award and just about every other prize you can win, ladies and gentlemen, Mr. Peter Fallow!! )J(   BONFIRE OF THE VANITIES - Rev. 4/25/90

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: As he rises unsteadily to his feet the room goes wild with applause. Peter waves and makes his way toward the podium.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what does it profit a man if he gains the whole world and loses ... Ah, well. There are compensations. Peter reaches the podium and faces a standing ovation. Cameras begin to flash. END CREDITS BEGIN.

dialogues.text: BEGINNING WITH Peter at the podium and CONTINUING to include SHOTS of everyone congratulating Peter -- Albert Fox, Reverend Bacon, Abe Weiss, Gerald Moore, Fillippo Chiarazzi, Kramer, etc. Finally the flashing cameras fade and we...

dialogues.text: lying in his bed.  Perfectly still. And then his nose twitches. His hand  comes up and scratches his nose. His eyes open. He sits  up, looks around, figures where he is. He gets out of  bed, disconnects the I.V.
